SettingValueDescription

Scheduled TaskInfraPortal-MonitoringRefreshRuns every 5 minutes on JD-PRINT01

ðŸš€ Implementation Steps

ðŸ’¡ To enable live data: Run the scheduled task on JD-PRINT01 to generate monitoring.json
  1. Deploy monitoring script: Copy Get-MonitoringData.ps1 to C:\Scripts\ on JD-PRINT01
  2. Create credentials file: Run Get-Credential | Export-Clixml C:\Scripts\monitoring-creds.xml
  3. Create scheduled task: 
    $action = New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute "pwsh.exe" -Argument "-File C:\Scripts\Get-MonitoringData.ps1"
$trigger = New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -Once -At (Get-Date) -RepetitionInterval (New-TimeSpan -Minutes 5)
Register-ScheduledTask -TaskName "InfraPortal-MonitoringRefresh" -Action $action -Trigger $trigger -User "SYSTEM"
  4. Test manually: Run C:\Scripts\Get-MonitoringData.ps1 to generate initial data
  5. Verify output: Check C:\inetpub\wwwroot\InfraPortal\api\data\monitoring.json

ðŸ“‹ Action Required: SSH to switches and run show version to obtain serial numbers, then check warranty at Cisco Warranty Check
ðŸ”§ SNMP Configuration Guide (for detailed port mapping)
â–¼
Step 1: SSH to switches for serial numbers
ssh admin@172.24.6.2   # Core switch
ssh admin@172.24.6.8   # Access switch

# Commands to run:
show version           # Get model, serial, IOS version
show mac address-table # Get MAC-to-port mapping
show interface status  # Get port status/speed
show cdp neighbors     # Get connected devices
show lldp neighbors    # Alternative to CDP
Step 2: Enable SNMP on switches
configure terminal
snmp-server community espeland-ro RO
snmp-server community espeland-rw RW
snmp-server host 172.24.6.22 traps espeland-ro
snmp-server enable traps
end
write memory
Step 3: Test SNMP from management station
# System info
snmpwalk -v2c -c espeland-ro 172.24.6.2 1.3.6.1.2.1.1

# Interface table
snmpwalk -v2c -c espeland-ro 172.24.6.2 1.3.6.1.2.1.2.2

# MAC address table (BRIDGE-MIB)
snmpwalk -v2c -c espeland-ro 172.24.6.2 1.3.6.1.2.1.17.4.3

# VLAN info (Cisco-specific)
snmpwalk -v2c -c espeland-ro 172.24.6.2 1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.46.1.3.1

  • â³ GLOBAL-SRV upgrade - Clean install recommended, takeover name/IP or new name (SQL Standard)
  • â³ Update all DNS references, SPNs, and service accounts

âš ï¸ Risk Matrix

Change AreaRisk LevelImpactMitigation Strategy

2016-WEB Rename Medium Practical work for IIS bindings, certificates, redirects Document all bindings, plan cutover window, test in parallel

VIADATA SQL 2022 Upgrade Medium VIA ERP application compatibility Vendor confirmation, full backup, maintenance window
Database Compat Level 160 Low Query plan changes Test in VIATEST first, monitor Query Store

ðŸ“‹ WSUS Implementation Steps

  5. Move servers to appropriate OUs or use client-side targeting

  2. Deploy Azure Arc agent to all servers: -DeployToServers -Ring All
  3. Create maintenance configurations: -CreateMaintenanceConfigurations
  4. Configure pre-update scripts for Nutanix snapshots in Azure Portal
  5. Tag OT servers with UpdatePolicy=Manual to exclude from auto-patching

ðŸ”„ In-Place Upgrade (Recommended for: 2016-WEB)

  1. Create VM snapshot/backup
  2. Mount WS2022 ISO
  3. Run setup.exe, select "Upgrade"
  4. Validate all services post-upgrade
  5. Rename to JD-naming standard

Pros: Faster, preserves settings
Cons: Inherits legacy issues

ðŸ†• Deploy New VM + Migrate (Recommended for: SQL, Print)

  1. Deploy fresh WS2022 VM via Nutanix
  2. Install roles/applications
  3. Migrate data and configurations
  4. Update DNS/GPO references
  5. Decommission old server

Pros: Clean state, best practices
Cons: More migration work

ðŸ“¡ Monitoring Solution

Documentation / Monitoring Solution

ðŸ—ï¸ Architecture Overview

Real-time infrastructure monitoring with VLAN relay support

â„¹ï¸ JD-DC02 acts as VLAN relay because JD-PRINT01 cannot directly reach VLAN 7 servers due to network segmentation

ðŸ“ Components

ComponentLocationPurpose
Collect-ServerMetrics.ps1 JD-PRINT01: C:\Scripts\ Main monitoring script
Collect-VlanMetrics.ps1 JD-DC02: C:\Scripts\ VLAN 7 relay collector
monitoring.json JD-PRINT01: wwwroot\api\data\ Combined monitoring data
vlan-monitoring.json JD-PRINT01: wwwroot\api\data\ VLAN 7 server data

â° Scheduled Tasks

TaskServerSchedule
Collect-ServerMetrics JD-PRINT01 Every 5 min
Collect-VlanMetrics JD-DC02 Every 5 min

ðŸ”§ Why VLAN Relay?

Network Isolation Issue: JD-PRINT01 (172.24.6.24) cannot directly reach VLAN 7 servers (172.24.7.x) due to VLAN segmentation.

Solution: JD-DC02 acts as a bridge server because it:

  • âœ… Can reach VLAN 7 servers (routing configured on firewall)
  • âœ… Can reach JD-PRINT01 (same VLAN 6)
  • âœ… Domain Controller - always online and trusted
  • âœ… JD-DC02$ computer account added to local Admins on VIADATA, VIAPROD, JD-PRINT01
